data.title: Really good food!
data.text: The Tequila Lime chicken is really good!  Chicken breast covered in verde sauce, rice, and instead of beans, they serve steamed veggies with this dish.  This make for a nice change.  This is my wife's favorite dish here.  I enjoy the pork enchilada with their white sauce.  The chips and salsa are good, as was the service.  We would recommend that you try this restaurant.

data.title: So very disappointed
data.text: Where to begin . . . Our group's orders were taken in a timely manner, and the waitress was pleasant.  That's the best part. After that, things went downhill. Dishes were mixed up, I never received a side I ordered. Several people who had the sweet pork burrito got scorched meat. My friend never even received her dinner at all. My taco salad was dry and bland. And then, the pleasant waitress avoided our group because there were so many mistakes made. None of us will EVER go back. EVER.

data.title: Old favorite
data.text: A little bit of Mexican food will do you good!  Very tasty dishes, but kitchen service was a little slow.  The place wasn't busy so not sure why the meal took so long to get to the table.  We enjoyed the  meal,  I didn't like the sticky table or the bench with the ripped cushion.  But if you don't mind your environment and love good food, go here.

data.title: Great Mexican
data.text: The chimichanga's are delicious!! The service is fast and friendly. The chops and salsa are heavenly. Save room for the fried ice cream desert.

data.title: Friendly and delicious
data.text: We visited on Sunday evening so there was no wait time.  Staff was friendly and efficient and the fajitas were tasty!  Reasonably priced and a fun environment.  Would definitely visit again when in town.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: This a very average, nothing special Mexican restaurant. My fajitas had generous amounts of onions bell peppers and cheese but the carne asada meat was tough and bland. Boring bland salsa. Chips not my favorite. Guacamole ok.

data.title: Good Mexican food. Large portions, good service
data.text: Went there with grandkids.  Everything was great, service was friendly and portions were very large.  Fried ice cream was out of this world.   Was recommended by our hotel and it was a good recommendation.  Would return.

data.title: Good Food, Reasonable Prices
data.text: Our lunch was enjoyable.  We ordered a chicken salad and the enchilada/chili  relleno combo.  The food was presented in an enticing manner, service was prompt, and we will return.  Always on the lookout for good Mexican food.

data.title: Nice location and building, but just average food
data.text: I would love to give this place a great review, but unfortunately it just doesn't quite make it..  the service is average and the food is just average as well.  We have visited this place several times over the past few years.. each time hoping it will improve..  the food just doesn't quite make it.. it is too americanized to be authentique.. the spices and menu are just cliche and don't offer anything unique or authentic to the Mexican culture or region. Too bad.. we really need a nice sit down Mexican Restaurant in St. George.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Love the chips and salsa! I get the enchiladas with sweet pork and the garlic white sauce! Such a good combination! Carne asada plate is also great! They also have a full bar if that is what you are looking for! Great place! :)

data.title: Good Food/Poor Service
data.text: We looked at Trip Advisor to find the best Mexican place in town. Casa wasn't rated the best but we decided to stop by anyway.   The server approached our table very rushed slamming things down. He was very short with us and left us feeling not very welcomed. However the food was outstanding.

data.title: Yummy for your tummy!
data.text: Was in St. George for a girls getaway trip with my mom and sisters and it was my oldest sisters Birthday so we decided to take her to Casa Dona Maria. The food was really really good and the portion size was huge. We left there stuffed. I would give them a 5 star rating but I have to complain about the waiter we had. I can’t remember her name but she did not pay attention to us and was very slow. We had to ask the hostess to refill our drinks and salsa.   Overall the place is nice and clean and we really enjoyed our evening. I will be visiting again but lets hope we get a better waiter.

data.title: Don't miss it.
data.text: My wife had fish tacos, I had flautas, and my friend had a vegetarian dish.  The Margarita topped it off.  Don't miss it.

data.title: Huge portions! They feed you.
data.text:
Visited after hiking all day, thus no special dress code...walked out STUFFED!! Guacamole was awesome...food had great taste...very reasonably priced...good safe location within city...we would return here again.

Only reason did not give 5 stars was our waiter was really bad...snooty, did not pay attention to us, ignored us after food delivered...slow...did not refill our drinks, hostess had to...good chance this restaurant has better servers and maybe he will not be there anymore when you visit.

data.title: Great atmosphere and nice location
data.text: We were at the temple and found this little hidden gem by accident. The restaurant is located a small strip mall. The interior is clean and well done. bathrooms were clean. We had the fajitas and a chimichanga and we were not disappointed. The service was friendly and we enjoyed our visit...

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: My husband and our daughter and I visited on a Saturday night. They were fairly busy but we were seated quickly. We were then quickly forgotten about too. A table of four were seated after us, ordered their drinks and food before we had a waiter to take our drink order. We are patient people and finally a hostess asked if we had been helped. We got a waiter. He was very polite and did an okay job at waiting our table. As for the food, I felt the portions were good for the price. I had shrimp and it was really good. My husband had fajitas, he said they were good as well. Our daughter ordered carne asada tacos, good but chewy.

data.title: Classic old style Mexican American restaurant
data.text:
We enjoyed our lunch here with both good food and a cozy atmosphere. The food tasted clean and was pleasant. It's not haute cuisine, just classic Americanized Mexican food. But it's presented well and served in a friendly casual atmosphere.
This restaurant isn't breaking any new ground but it's doing the traditional in a professional way.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: Well, to begin with, the Margaritas  tasted awful and terribly watered down by the ice. Such is the sad reality of cocktails  in Utah. Food was very average and nothing to rave about.

data.title: Bummer, easily forgettable meal
data.text: Arrived at lunch hour, front was completely disorganized.  Nobody was seating anyone, people in line couldn't provide info as they haven't been greeted.  Finally got a seat, no menus just poor all the way around, and finally got an apologetic server.  Chips and salsa were not good, chips were literally stale, something I haven't ever had that I can remember.  My wife says come on, she takes a bite she's like wow.  I'm like yeah that's bad.  Main dish didn't save the day, yeah it was ok but bland basic nothing special.  We took a doggy bag to go, and we didn't eat it.  Wouldn't ever return, nothing much positive here.  Night before tried to show up, hours were listed as close at 10pm was closed at 9:15pm.

data.title: Food was DELICIOUS
data.text: Love love LOVED the food here, and there is a service that will deliver it to your hotel for a nominal fee.
